DataElement.preferredName: FACT-Cognitive Questionnaire Problem Remembering Reason Room Entry Score Frequency 5 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric response to a questionnaire item asking about if an individual has walked into a room and forgotten the reason for doing so.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-Cognitive Questionnaire Problem Remembering Reason Room Entry Frequency Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Cognitive; of or being or relating to or involving cognition._A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.__A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution._The power of retaining and recalling past experience, something that is remembered._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action._An area within a building enclosed by walls and floor and ceiling._An item inserted in a written or electronic record._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)_A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cognitive; of or being or relating to or involving cognition.:A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.

Concepts.definition: Of or being or relating to or involving cognition.

A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.
